textbooks.title: Social network analysis: Methods and applications
textbooks.author: Wasserman, S. & Faust, K.

topics: Lab 2: Basic Social Network Analysis in R
Structural Properties and Tie Formation I (Presentation Week)
Structural Properties and Tie Formation II (Presentation Week)
Node Attributes, Homophily and Communities (Presentation Week)
Lab 4: Community Detection and Network Visualization
Node Positions, Tie Strength and Social Capital (Presentation Week)
Social Influence, Diffusion and Contagion (Presentation Week)

grading.policies: Graduate students need a grade of C or above to pass the course.

assignments.title: Lab Exercises
assignments.description: Exercises for methods/topics discussed in labs.
assignments.submission: To be submitted online through Canvas. Due before the next class begins.

assignments.title: Paper Presentation and Response
assignments.description: Present 1 course readings in class (15%), and participate in in-class discussions of the papers (5%).

assignments.title: Class Participation
assignments.description: Attendance and participation in in-class exercises and quizzes.

assignments.title: Final Project Report and Presentation
assignments.description: Students work in groups of 3-4 to analyze a secondary social network data. Includes an oral in-class presentation for 10-15 minutes (10%) and a 12-15 page written report (25%).

policies.attendance: Attendance without participation in class will only receive a passing grade (3%).
policies.late_work: Late penalty: 20% will be deducted for each late day. No homework will be accepted 3 days after the due date.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: In-person class on Thursdays from 6:30-9:00PM EST.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Please bring your laptop to class and Install R and Gelphi on your laptop.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Disability Services for accommodations.

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces concepts, theories, and tools of social network analysis (SNA). Application areas include social media analytics, information and technology diffusion and market segmentation and targeting.
learning_outcomes: Understand concepts and theories of social networks
Learn how to collect and analyze social networks data
Acquire analytical skills to conduct social network analysis
